page.title: 15SOCIAL CONCERNS
page.content: Netherbury Charities are administered by a committee of local people drawn from Netherbury, Salway Ash and Melplash. The available yearly income is divided among 4 main funds: Smith's Educational Fund: most of which is allocated to Salway Ash Primary School, contributions going to Netherbury Play Groups. Distribution Fund: covers donations to local organisations and voluntary societies according to their need, village hall, churchyard, playing field. Coal Club Fund: provides Christmas coal to the aged, infirm or any in special need. Clothing Fund: allocates money equally to each child from the parish leaving Salway Ash to go on to Beaminster, helping with the necessary uniform. The first recorded account of an award from a donor is Smith in 1567, followed by Lake and many others.
